revised_title: Alfred William Porter: A Tribute to a Pioneering Physicist and Educator
tldr: Alfred William Porter was a dedicated educator and physicist who made significant contributions to the field of thermodynamics and physics education. He was a reliable and original investigator, known for reformulating theories with precision. Porter was elected as a Fellow of the Royal Society in 1911 and served in various roles in scientific societies throughout his career. He was an excellent teacher, especially for senior students, and is remembered for his work in thermodynamics and as a key figure in the development of physics at University College, London.
